ROW.body: A dark room. A long wooden bar. A couple of middle-aged guys playing video trivia in the corner. A staff who couldn’t care less. Who would guess there’d be lines around the corner to get in here come 2am? Guess that’s what a 4am license gets ya.
ROW.cta: El: Brown, Purple (rush hrs) to Armitage. Bus: 8, 11, 73
ROW.features: No stairs to bathroom Wheelchair-accessible bathroom Late Night Private party room(s) Video/pinball games
ROW.name: The Store

ROW.body: Quite possibly the straightest bar in Andersonville, this place gets packed on the weekends with breeders who stop by to drink Goose Island 312, shoot pool, watch some sports, and, sometimes, get drunk by themselves near the patio doors and yell things at passersby.
ROW.name: Farragut’s

ROW.body: This bilevel Wrigleyville joint draws a strange crowd: a mix of ball-capped football fans paying full attention to the wall-size TV behind the bar and aspiring improv comics from nearby I.O. who love to rehash favorite bits and revel in their ironic choice of destination. No group pays any heed to the other, particularly when the orders of Tater Tots arrive.
ROW.crossstreet: between Cornelia Ave and Eddy St
ROW.features: No steps at entrance Good for groups Darts No stairs to bathroom Sports bar Outdoor seating Food served Video/pinball games Private party room(s)
ROW.name: Mullen’s on Clark

ROW.body: Guys, don’t even bother. This River North hangout has plenty of tables to nosh on a burger and a big, circular bar with plenty of stools to put down your pints. But after work it’s crowded three-suits-deep with men trying to flirt with the gorgeous bartenders, so only a woman could get lucky here.
ROW.features: Pool table Video/pinball games No stairs to bathroom No steps at entrance Outdoor seating Late Night Food served
ROW.name: The Boss Bar

ROW.body: This Rogers Park corner bar is a lesson in—well—a neighborhood corner bar: sports on the TVs, cold beer on tap and a bunch of dudes flapping their jaws about their favorite teams. For those allergic to sports, picture windows look out over the street, and we have to admit that watching traffic and sipping a beer isn’t a bad way to spend a Sunday afternoon.
ROW.name: Lamp Post Tavern

ROW.body: If ever there was a cursed space, it’s the former Darwin’s/Whiskey Road/Chinaski’s. The latest inhabitant has done away with the gimmicks and opened the doors onto the sidewalk with a list of decent beers and margaritas. If friendly servers, exposed brick and a diverse jukebox don’t cut it, the new owners offer one appeal to gluttonous patrons: the Horseshoe, an open-face sandwich laden with cheese fries.
ROW.features: Food served No stairs to bathroom Wheelchair-accessible bathroom
ROW.name: 6 Degrees
